title: [Self-Directed] Social and Ubiquitous Learning Environment Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Basic pedagogical theory and experience utilizing mobile devices
context.additional_context: Enhancing instructional design capabilities for language education by applying social connectivity and ubiquitous learning principles in smartphone-centric, limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners can propose three or more language learning activity designs that promote social interaction
Develop ubiquitous learning scenarios using smartphone-based tools (KakaoTalk, Google Docs, etc.)
Design a five-stage feedback system to measure learner engagement through formative assessment

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
